identificationModule.officialTitle: Eye Movement Studies of Visual Search

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Using a noninvasive eye tracker, the investigators will measure how participants move their eyes to objects arrayed on a computer screen. Participants will be asked to find one element among many.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The investigators measure how quickly and how accurately participants can move their eyes from a central fixation point to a target object arrayed with one or more distractor objects. A noninvasive eye tracker will be used to measure their eye movements. Participants may also be asked to make a decision about a feature of the target they have selected with a key press. Difficulty of the search for the target object and difficulty of the decision about a feature of the target object will be manipulated.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Participants are asked to view an array of objects on a computer screen equipped with a noninvasive eye tracker. They are asked to search for a target object among one or more distractor objects and may be asked to respond to a feature of the target object with a key press that was selected via a gaze shift.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: Manipulation is within-participant. Participants view multiple visual search arrays in an experimental session. They will be masked with regards to the difficulty and timing manipulations until they experience them on a trial.

armGroups.label: Within Subjects Experimental Design
armGroups.description: All participants are tested in all conditions.

interventions.name: Target and Stimulus
interventions.description: The investigators manipulate the difficulty of search for the target object by manipulating the number of distractor objects and/or the similarity between the target and distractors. The investigators manipulate the difficulty of the decision about a feature by manipulating the similarity of the feature to a criterion. The investigators manipulate the timing of when the decision feature appears on the object relative to the onset of the array and/or the onset of the saccade away from fixation in a gaze-contingent manner.

primaryOutcomes.description: Saccade Events, Fixation Events, Pupil Size

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Sona System users (open to the public)

Exclusion Criteria:

* participants that fail the Ishihara color vision screening test
* participants with acuity worse than 20/20 with or without correction
* children under 18
* adults over 50

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Only de-identified behavioral data will be shared with other investigators upon request.
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: Data will be shared after all analyses and modeling of the data are complete and manuscripts resulting from the research are accepted for publication.
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria: We will share data with investigators who request (after research using the data are complete).
